column5: Nov 20 Peabody Energy Corp said it agreed to sell its New Mexico and Colorado coal assets to Bowie Resource Partners LLC for $358 million in cash.

column4: Brazil's Levy sees no immediate need for Petrobras capital injection
column5: HALF MOON BAY  California There is no immediate need for a capital injection at Brazilian state-run oil firm Petrobras  Finance Minister Joaquim Levy said on Friday  downplaying media reports about a possible government plan to bolster the capital of the heavily indebted company.

column4: Brazil's Levy sees no immediate need for Petrobras capital injection
column5: HALF MOON BAY  California  Nov 20 There is no immediate need for a capital injection at Brazilian state-run oil firm Petrobras  Finance Minister Joaquim Levy said on Friday  downplaying media reports about a possible government plan to bolster the capital of the heavily indebted company.

column4: LATAM WRAP-Petrobras extends rally on capital plan
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 20 (IFR) - Petrobras was leading LatAm credit markets higher on Friday following news that the Brazilian government was considering a plan to inject fresh capital into the beleaguered oil company.

column4: Exclusive: Pfizer  Allergan CEOs agree on combined company roles - sources
column5: Pfizer Inc and Allergan Inc chief executives have agreed on the roles they would assume in a combined company  removing one of the last hurdles to the largest ever healthcare merger  people familiar with the matter said.

column4: Exclusive: Pfizer negotiating 2-3 percent Allergan break-up fee - sources
column5: Pfizer Inc  is negotiating a 2-3 percent break-up fee with Allergan Plc  that would be in line with most deals  people familiar with the matter said  a sign of confidence that such a merger could overcome regulatory hurdles.

column4: PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - Nov 20
column5: Nov 20 The following are the top stories in the Wall Street Journal. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

column4: U.S. unveils new inversion rules; unlikely to thwart Pfizer
column5: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK The U.S. Treasury Department on Thursday took steps to clamp down on tax-avoiding "inversion" deals with new rules  though there was scarce evidence they would stop the biggest inversion of them all  between Pfizer Inc  and Allergan Plc .

column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. unveils new inversion rules; unlikely to thwart Pfizer
column5: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK  Nov 19 The U.S. Treasury Department on Thursday took steps to clamp down on tax-avoiding "inversion" deals with new rules  though there was scarce evidence they would stop the biggest inversion of them all  between Pfizer Inc and Allergan Plc.

column4: CORRECTED-Sanofi and AstraZeneca to exchange 210 000 chemical compounds
column5: Nov 20 Sanofi and AstraZeneca  said on Friday that they will exchange 210 000 chemical compounds in a deal aimed at widening the diversity of the chemicals they can use to develop new drugs.

column4: Southern Copper may have paid bribes to halt Peru protests: prosecutor
column5: LIMA A Peruvian prosecutor said she suspects that U.S.-listed mining company Southern Copper Corp paid opponents to call off protests against its $1.4 billion Tia Maria project while it was waiting for an environmental permit.

column4: Southern Copper may have paid bribes to halt Peru protests -prosecutor
column5: LIMA  Nov 20 A Peruvian prosecutor said she suspects that U.S.-listed mining company Southern Copper Corp  paid opponents to call off protests against its $1.4 billion Tia Maria project while it was waiting for an environmental permit.

column4: Sprint to raise $1.1 billion from financing deal led by SoftBank
column5: Sprint Corp  said it would raise about $1.1 billion in cash through a sale and lease-back deal with a company whose backers include Japan's SoftBank Group Corp   the U.S. telecom company's majority owner.

column4: UPDATE 3-Sprint to raise $1.1 bln from financing deal led by SoftBank
column5: Nov 20 Sprint Corp said it would raise about $1.1 billion in cash through a sale and lease-back deal with a company whose backers include Japan's SoftBank Group Corp   the U.S. telecom company's majority owner.

column4: Sprint set to raise $1.1 bln from sale/lease-back deal
column5: Nov 20 Sprint Corp said it would raise about $1.1 billion in cash by selling and then leasing back some leased-out mobile devices to a company whose backers include SoftBank Group Corp.

column4: UPDATE 5-Dorsey's Square jumps in market debut  offering hope to tech startups
column5: Nov 19 Shares of Square Inc  the mobile payments company co-founded and still run by Twitter Inc  Chief Executive Jack Dorsey  soared as much as 64 percent in their market debut  following a marked-down initial public offering  countering the negative sentiment that has nagged at Silicon Valley startups in recent weeks.

column4: Exclusive: Supervalu to consider potential Save-A-Lot sale - sources
column5: Grocery distributor Supervalu Inc  is preparing to explore an outright sale as an alternative to a spin-off of its discount grocery retail chain Save-A-Lot  according to people familiar with the matter.

column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) LONDON  November 20 (Fitch) Fitch has not factored these developments into the  ratings although the motivations or intentions of material shareholders are  important to monitor. The strategic logic of Vivendi's interest in TI has merit   with the owner of France's leading pay-TV platform  Canal Plus  thought to be  interested in the potential of TV distribution opportunities by partnering with  TI in Italy and potentially Brazil. column4: French and Benelux stocks-Factors to watch on Nov 20
column5: PARIS  Nov 20 Below are company-related news and stories from French and Benelux media which could have an impact on the region's markets or individual stocks.

column4: Fidelity plans new 'robo-adviser' to manage money for clients online
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 20 Fidelity Investments is building an automated portfolio-management service for individual investors  joining a growing group of money and brokers that have bought or designed such "robo-advisers " a spokesman for the firm said Friday.

column4: Toyota likely to hit goal of 1.1 mln vehicles sold in China this yr -exec
column5: GUANGZHOU  China  Nov 20 Toyota is likely to achieve its goal of selling 1.1 million vehicles in China this year  China chief Hiroji Onishi said at the annual Guangzhou auto show on Friday.

column4: Canadian regulator halts TransCanada pipeline construction following spills
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Nov 20 Canada's national energy regulator has halted construction on a new TransCanada Corp natural gas pipeline after reviewing evidence that it may have spilled a toxic drilling fluid into a major Western Canadian river  a spokesman said on Friday.

column4: Health insurer Aetna reaffirms 2015 profit forecast
column5: Nov 20 Health insurer Aetna reaffirmed its full-year 2015 operating earnings forecast on Friday  a day after UnitedHealth Group Inc cut its guidance  blaming deteriorating performance in its individual Obamacare business.

column4: U.S. judge dismisses Rio Tinto lawsuit against Vale
column5: BRASILIA/NEW YORK A U.S. judge on Friday dismissed Rio Tinto's lawsuit accusing rival Vale and others of conspiring to misappropriate its mining rights in the Simandou region in Guinea.

column4: UPDATE 3-U.S. judge dismisses Rio Tinto lawsuit against Vale
column5: BRASILIA/NEW YORK  Nov 20 A U.S. judge on Friday dismissed Rio Tinto's lawsuit accusing rival Vale  and others of conspiring to misappropriate its mining rights in the Simandou region in Guinea.

column4: Saskatchewan seeks price protection in altering potash taxes
column5: WINNIPEG  Manitoba Potash-rich Saskatchewan hopes to revise its taxes on production of the crop fertilizer to avoid big revenue drops in years when prices sag  the Canadian province's economy minister said on Friday.

column4: Valeant to host investor day on Dec. 16  discuss forecast  business
column5: Nov 20 Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc   said on Friday that it would host its investor day on Dec. 16 to discuss its financial guidance and business operations.

column4: Wal-Mart scrimped on hiring as store space grew rapidly
column5: CHICAGO Wal-Mart has been dogged by criticism of the standard of its stores in recent years  including long checkout lines and insufficient stocking of its shelves. A Reuters analysis of the giant discount retailer’s growth and its employee numbers may help explain why.

column4: CORRECTED-Wells Fargo likely to issue more debt to comply with new rules
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 6 Wells Fargo & Co will likely need to issue an additional $40 billion to $60 billion of long-term debt to comply with new rules designed to help banks better weather a crisis  Chief Financial Officer John Shrewsberry said on Friday.

column4: Fitch Rates Welltower's CAD Senior Unsecured Notes 'BBB+'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  November 20 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned a 'BBB+' rating to the  CAD300 million of 3.35% senior unsecured notes due 2020 issued by HCN Canadian  Holdings-1 LP. The issuer is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Welltower Inc. (NYSE:  HCN  'BBB+') and the notes are unconditionally guaranteed. The notes were priced  at 99.74% of par to yield 3.407% to maturity.
